intro: Berkheya buphthalmoides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seeds resembling dandelion fluff. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its ornamental value is complemented by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
